rows.description: Insert a loop cut aligned to the current edge flow, perfect for adding supporting geometry before a bevel.
rows.exampleAlt: Viewport showing a highlighted loop cut ready to confirm.
rows.exampleNote: After the first confirm you can move the loop and roll the wheel to add multiples.

rows.description: Bevel the selected edges or vertices with adjustable segments and profile.
rows.exampleAlt: Edges smoothed by the bevel tool with profile controls visible.
rows.exampleNote: Use the mouse wheel for segment count and Shift to slow bevel width adjustments.

rows.description: Shrink/fatten along vertex normals—ideal for adjusting thickness after a solidify modifier.
rows.exampleAlt: Inset mesh being pushed outward evenly along normals.
rows.exampleNote: Tap E right after to toggle even mode for tubes and cables.

rows.description: Apply scale/rotation before boolean or array modifiers to avoid skewed results.
rows.exampleAlt: Modifier stack showing boolean, bevel, and weighted normal modifiers.
rows.exampleNote: Keep the Weighted Normal modifier after your boolean + bevel combo to clean shading.

rows.descriptionHtml: Set the boolean object to Fast solver for simple cuts; switch to Exact when non-manifold edges appear.
rows.exampleAlt: Boolean modifier configured above a bevel modifier for clean chamfers.
rows.exampleNote: Stack booleans above the bevel so new edges inherit the same chamfer width.

rows.description: Vertex bevel—great for rounding boolean corners before applying modifiers.
rows.exampleAlt: Vertex selected with small supporting bevel applied.
rows.exampleNote: Use custom profiles for perfect fillets that match your bevel modifier.
